channel.title: CVE Feed for wpeventmanager -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpeventmanager -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-2691|2024-07-22T14:34:33.218Z -- wpeventmanager -- wp%20event%20manager%20%E2%80%93%20events%20calendar%2C%20registrations%2C%20sell%20tickets%20with%20woocommerce
item.description: The WP Event Manager – Events Calendar, Registrations, Sell Tickets with WooCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's 'events' shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 3.1.43 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-0976|2024-06-24T16:33:10.562Z -- wpeventmanager -- wp%20event%20manager%20%E2%80%93%20events%20calendar%2C%20registrations%2C%20sell%20tickets%20with%20woocommerce
item.description: The WP Event Manager – Events Calendar, Registrations, Sell Tickets with WooCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.1.41 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-0976|2024-03-13T15:26:48.336Z -- wpeventmanager -- wp%20event%20manager%20%E2%80%93%20events%20calendar%2C%20registrations%2C%20sell%20tickets%20with%20woocommerce

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
